business.headline: RBI simplifies process for claim settlement of deceased account holdersThe new framework by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has been introduced to remove the confusion caused by different practices followed by banks earlier.

When will the 8th Pay Commission be implemented? Here's what you should knowThe Pay Commission affects much more than basic salaries. It influences allowances, pensions, and long-term financial security. In times of rising inflation, employees and pensioners are especially keen for the Commission's work to begin.

From CEOs to ministers, support pours in for Zoho's ArattaiThe rise of Arattai has caught the attention of users, industry leaders, and public figures, many of whom have shared their support and congratulations for Zoho and its founder, Sridhar Vembu.

Who should invest in Tata Capital IPO? Market expert weighs inThe Tata Capital IPO is around the corner, and many investors are wondering whether it's the right bet. A market expert has broken down who should consider subscribing and who may want to stay cautious.

Sensex, Nifty close flat as investors turn cautious over US-India trade dealThe S&P BSE Sensex closed 61.52 points lower to end at 80,364.94, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 19.80 points to close at 24,634.90.

Moody's keeps India's Baa3 rating unchanged with stable outlookMoody's said India's strengths include its large and fast-growing economy, a sound external position, and a stable domestic financing base for fiscal deficits.

Beyond metros: How festive cheer boosts real estate demand in Tier-2 citiesWhile metros grab most of the headlines, smaller cities are quietly stealing the show. With festivals around the corner, Tier-2 cities are witnessing a strong spike in property interest and sales.

Lufthansa layoffs: German airline plans 4,000 job cuts over next 5 yearsThe job cuts will mainly affect administrative roles rather than operational positions such as pilots, cabin crew or ground staff.

Does EPFO's new ECR system simplify return filing for employers?The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has launched a revamped electronic challan-cum-return (ECR) system, aiming to make return filing easier and more accurate for employers. But does it really simplify the process?

Will RBI announce a rate cut in the upcoming MPC meeting? Here's what to expectThe Reserve Bank of India's Monetary Policy Committee begins its three-day meeting to decide whether it is time to cut interest rates or hold steady. With inflation easing and growth signals mixed, all eyes are on what the central bank does next.
Experts reveal best festive stocks to buy amid global uncertaintyConcerns over global trade talks with the US and new protectionist measures have weighed on investor sentiment
Sensex opens 142 points higher, Nifty above 24,500; BEL gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 114.15 points to 80,540.61, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 36.45 points to 24,691.15 as of 9:24 am.

entertainment.headline: Jay Kelly trailer: George Clooney plays fading movie icon, Adam Sandler his manager Actor George Clooney returns in 'Jay Kelly', a dramedy about fame and family struggles. The film explores personal reckonings and complex relationships against a Hollywood backdrop.

Allu Arjun wishes cutie wife Sneha Reddy with vacation pics Actor Allu Arjun celebrated wife Sneha Reddy's birthday with a heartfelt social media wish. The actor shared scenic pictures from their vacation.

Saad Bilgrami says several Dhadak 2 scenes left him emotional, crying after shoot Actor Saad Bilgrami shared in an exclusive conversation that it was very difficult for him to shoot certain emotionally charged scenes in the film. He plays Ronnie in the romantic film.

Veteran theatre artist and filmmaker Yashwant Sardeshpande dies of heart attack Yashwant Sardeshpande, a celebrated Kannada theatre artist and filmmaker, died of a heart attack in Bengaluru. His death marks a significant loss to Karnataka's cultural and performing arts community.

Rishab Shetty's Kantara Chennai event cancelled after stampede at Vijay's rally Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara Chapter 1' promotional event was cancelled in Chennai after a stampede at Vijay's rally left 41 dead. The production house shared a statement and condemned the tragic incident.

Saiyaara actor Ahaan Panday to feature in Ali Abbas Zafar's next with YRF: Report 'Saiyaara' actor Ahaan Panday has signed his second film with director Ali Abbas Zafar and producer Aditya Chopra according to a report. The untitled project is expected to begin filming in early 2026.

Rajeev Sen, ex-wife Charu go pandal hopping with daughter in Kolkata. See pics Rajeev Sen and Charu Asopa celebrated Navratri together in Kolkata with their daughter Ziana. Charu shared photos of them exploring various pandas as a family. Their reunion comes after their divorce in 2023.

Shin-chan's Spicy Kasukabe Dancers proves Bo-chan is no sidekick In this week's Animania we discuss how Bo-chan takes centre stage in 'Shin-chan: Super Hot! Spicy Kasukabe Dancers', proving the quietest characters can leave the loudest impact.

After seven years, Cardi B lands 2nd Billboard No 1 with Am I the Drama? Singer Cardi B's new album 'Am I the Drama?' debuts at No 1 on the Billboard 200. This marks her second chart-topping release and the biggest week for an R&B/hip-hop album by a woman in 2025.

The Raja Saab trailer: Prabhas fights ghosts and ghouls in haunted mansion The trailer of the horror-comedy 'The Raja Saab' released on September 29, 2025. The film features actors Prabhas, Sanjay Dutt, Malavika Mohanan and Nidhhi Agerwal in pivotal roles.

Karan Johar produces India's first fashion reality show India is set to launch its first fashion reality show aimed at showcasing homegrown designers on a global platform with support from Bollywood stars and major investors. The series highlights the journey of emerging talents from smaller towns.

Thamma's Tum Mere Na Huye stars Ayushmann, Rashmika in glam avatar The first song from 'Thamma' titled 'Tum Mere Na Huye, Na Sahi' is finally out. Featuring Rashmika Mandanna and Ayushmann Khurrana, the song blends heartbreak with eye-catching dance moves. Have a look.
My Sam: Riddhima Kapoor Sahni shares adorable mother-daughter moment with Samara Riddhima Kapoor Sahni shared a heartfelt mother-daughter moment with her daughter Samara on Instagram.

Before Kantara Chapter 1, here's a recap and guide to world of Rishab Shetty's film 'Kantara: Chapter 1', written, directed and starring Rishab Shetty, is slated for a grand release on October 2. Ahead of the film's release, here is a recap of 'Kantara', which took Kannada cinema to global stardom.

Priyanka gives shout-out to Diljit, Chamkila team for International Emmy nomination Priyank Chopra wrote a special message for Diljit Dosanjh and the 'Amar Singh Chamkila' team after Emmy nominations. The film has bagged nominations in two categories, including Best Performance by an Actor and Best TV Movie.

Siddhant Chaturvedi grooves to Khaike Paan with college students in Varanasi. Watch Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi attended a college event in Varanasi, dancing with students. Videos of the actor enjoying himself with the students have gone viral.

An OG love letter: When Pawan Kalyan delivered, fans said thank you The release of 'They Call Him OG' marks the triumphant return of Pawan Kalyan, rekindling the passion of his devoted fans across India with a powerful blend of style and emotion. This gangster epic is not just a film but a heartfelt celebration of a two-decade-long bond between the star and his unwavering audience.

BTS' V and IVE's Jang Wonyoung dating? Internet discovers alleged proof Online speculation grew over a possible relationship between BTS' V and IVE's Jang Wonyoung. Social media users shared a 'proof list' connecting the two K-pop idols.

Just did my job: Actor Ashish Kumar on his cop act in The Ba***ds of Bollywood Actor Ashish Kumar responded to the allegations about how his character is allegedly based on Sameer Wankhede. Former NCB officer Wankhede sued Aryan Khan, Shah Rukh Khan, and Netflix for defamation.

general news.headline: Israel won't occupy Gaza: Trump, Netanyahu agree on US-backed plan to end warThe White House released Trump's 20-point plan. The proposal does not require Palestinians to leave Gaza and calls for an immediate ceasefire once both sides sign on.

Vijay's party functionary arrested after Karur rally stampede claimed 41 livesTVK functionary Mathiazhagan was arrested on Monday in the Karur rally stampede case that claimed 41 lives and injured 60 others.

Netanyahu accepts Trump's Gaza deal, warns Israel will act if Hamas rejects planNetanyahu backed Trump's 20-point Gaza plan on Monday, calling it a critical step to end the war. The proposal calls for an international Board of Peace, phased Israeli withdrawal and hostage releases.

Ozempic approved in India, Novo Nordisk country head says 'much-needed'As India grapples with a surge in lifestyle-related illnesses, the approval of Ozempic marks more than just a new diabetes drug; it signals a shift toward modernising chronic disease care. Calling it a "much needed move," Novo Nordisk India's managing director welcomed the decision as a timely intervention.

What's happening in the garb of the garba?Once a spiritual, community-centred dance in Gujarat, garba has now been commercialised. Its folk forms are dying in Gujarat itself, but the dance is uniting people across age groups, from Delhi to Bengaluru. The dhol beats and dandiya clicks might have been replaced by techno, but its new avatar still has the same old energy.
Trump slaps 100% tariff on non-US made films, says other countries stole businessTrump said he will be imposing a 100% tariff on any and all movies that are made outside the United States.

Canada lists Bishnoi gang as terrorist entity, says it's creating climate of fearAnnouncing the decision, Minister of Public Safety Gary Anandasangaree said that acts of violence and terror have no place in Canada, especially those that target specific communities to create a climate of fear and intimidation.

How an 'expression of devotion' caused sectarian violence in Uttar PradeshThe ripples caused when a board with "I Love Mohammed" written on it was controversially removed in Kanpur turned violent as they reached Bareilly 250 km away, where the police wished to rule out any protest.

Faster than making Maggi: China cuts travel of 2 hours to 2 mins with highest bridgeSlashing travel time across the canyon from two hours to just two minutes, China has opened the Huajiang Grand Canyon Bridge in Guizhou, now the world's highest at 625 meters above the ground. Completed over more than three years, the bridge stretches 1,420 meters across the canyon.

Silver stolen but spirit of gold: Champions India glitter despite Mohsin Naqvi heistAfter being denied of their moment in the spotlight by a lame attempt from PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi, the Indian team showed, through humour and passion, that their spirit will not be dimmed by any underhand tactics and celebrated their Asia Cup win.

29-year-old trainee doctor jumps to death from 21st floor in NoidaFamily members told police that Shiva developed a mental health condition during the pandemic, leading him to discontinue his medical training and had been in depression since.

How 'I love Muhammad' row gives Yogi Adityanath ammo against Akhilesh YadavAnalysts say the issue, initially local, has been transformed into a broader ideological debate, allowing UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanth to consolidate support on a Hindutva platform during Navratri and force the Samajwadi Party into a balancing act.

Why tea shop culture still matters in India and beyondAs urban India embraces slick, air-conditioned tea cafes, and even highbrow tea lounges, the old-school tea shop raises a question: Is the humble tea shop still relevant in today's India?

Leh Apex Body quits talks with Centre, seeks apology for 'anti-national' remarkThe next round of talks between the Centre and representatives of Ladakh, including members of the Leh Apex Body and the Kargil Democratic Alliance (KDA), was scheduled for October 6.

World Para Athletics Championships: Javelin star Rinku Hooda bags India's 2nd goldRinku Hooda and Sundar Singh Gurjar produced a historic one-two finish in the men's javelin throw F46 at the World Para Athletics Championships.

Who disrupted BJP's 10-year winning streak in Assam?Assam, where the BJP has of late enjoyed an uninterrupted electoral run since 2016, has faced the first defeat as Hagrama Mohilary's Bodo People's Front (BPF) swept the 2025 Bodoland Territorial Council (BTC) elections. The sweep by Mohilary's BPF has disrupted the BJP's dominance, just ahead of the Assam Assembly election.

Before Kantara Chapter 1, here's a recap and guide to world of Rishab Shetty's film'Kantara: Chapter 1', written, directed and starring Rishab Shetty, is slated for a grand release on October 2. Ahead of the film's release, here is a recap of 'Kantara', which took Kannada cinema to global stardom.

Stick to sports: Kapil Dev opens up on India-Pakistan controversy in Asia CupIn an interview with India Today, legendary India captain Kapil Dev urged that cricket remain free from political interference after India's five-wicket win over Pakistan in the Asia Cup final.

How the deaths in Karur stain TVK chief Vijay's prospectsThe stampede deaths during filmstar Vijay's Karur rally cast a shadow on his political ambitions, besides raising uncomfortable questions on the priorities of celebrity-politicians during their rallies in Tamil Nadu.

Bengaluru tenant recovers Rs 2.6 lakh deposit after dispute with landlord, shares howIn the post shared on r/Bangalorerentals, the tenant said that he had rented a 3.5 BHK apartment for Rs 55,000 a month during the Covid-19 period, but later found himself in conflict with the flat owner, a retired Army officer.

An OG love letter: When Pawan Kalyan delivered, fans said thank youThe release of 'They Call Him OG' marks the triumphant return of Pawan Kalyan, rekindling the passion of his devoted fans across India with a powerful blend of style and emotion. This gangster epic is not just a film but a heartfelt celebration of a two-decade-long bond between the star and his unwavering audience.

Enough is enough: Thousands in POK erupt in protest against Pak governmentThe Awami Action Committee (AAC) called the "shutter down wheel-jam" strike across Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir, forcing authorities to deploy heavy security and internet blackout.

India humare baap hai: Pakistanis roast cricket team after Asia Cup lossFrom fans to former cricketers to journalists, Pakistanis are blasting their team and players, left, right and centre, after the team's loss to India in the Asia Cup final. There's a storm of anger, memes, and soul-searching that is laying bare the deep crisis in Pakistan cricket.

Viral video: Food delivery worker's daring escape as US immigration agents chase himA video of nearly 10 Immigration agents chasing a food delivery worker in Chicago went viral, sparking debate over enforcement methods.

sports.headline: Asia Cup: Suryakumar Yadav, Hardik receive warm welcome in Mumbai after title win Team India's finest, skipper Suryakumar Yadav and star all-rounder Hardik Pandya received a rousing response as they returned to the Mumbai airport following their triumph at the Asia Cup, downing Pakistan to win the title.

2nd T20I: Nepal secure historic series win vs West Indies with 90-run victory Nepal achieved a historic milestone on Monday (September 29), securing their first-ever T20I series win over a full-member nation by dominating former world champions West Indies in the second match in Sharjah.

Watch: Tilak Varma receives rousing welcome in Hyderabad after Asia Cup heroics India's Asia Cup 2025 final hero, Tilak Varma, received a rapturous welcome from fans as he returned to Hyderabad on Monday. The 21-year-old southpaw, who scored an unbeaten 69 to seal victory against Pakistan, was greeted with thunderous cheers at Shamshabad Airport.

Women's World Cup in India watershed moment for the game: Sachin Tendulkar Sachin Tendulkar believes the ICC Women's World Cup in India marks a pivotal moment for women's cricket, calling on the nation to embrace it as a catalyst for fresh aspirations and equal recognition.

Gutted to miss final but Indian team showed character: Hardik on Asia Cup win Hardik Pandya was understandably "gutted" to have missed the Asia Cup final against Pakistan due to a niggle, but he found comfort in the team's title triumph, saying such tight chases will stand the side in good stead for the future.

India are under no pressure: Harmanpreet confident of winning Women's World Cup India women's cricket captain Harmanpreet Kaur expresses strong confidence ahead of their first ODI World Cup match at home. The team aims to leverage recent successes and fan support to make history in the tournament.

World Para Athletics Championships: Javelin star Rinku Hooda bags India's 2nd gold Rinku Hooda and Sundar Singh Gurjar produced a historic one-two finish in the men's javelin throw F46 at the World Para Athletics Championships.

Pakistan players were saying lot of things, I wanted my bat to respond: Tilak Varma Pakistan players had "a lot to say" to Tilak Varma as he walked out to bat in the Asia Cup final, spurring the young Indian batter to play one of the most defining innings of his career so far in the Asia Cup final.

Watch: Mohammad Amir nearly brought to tears after Pakistan's Asia Cup final loss Mohammad Amir was nearly brought to tears after Pakistan lost the Asia Cup final to India. His reflections highlight Pakistan's batting failures and praise India's Tilak Varma's composure.

Hope an Asian team wins Women's World Cup this time: Sri Lanka captain Chamari Sri Lanka captain Chamari Athapaththu hopes an Asian side will win the Women's World Cup as her team returns to the tournament on home soil.

IND vs WI: Alzarri Joseph ruled out of India Test series due to lower back injury IND vs WI: Alzarri Joseph has been ruled out of the India Test series due to a lower back injury. This injury poses a significant challenge for the West Indies team ahead of the crucial matches.

World Para Athletics Championships: Javelin star Rinku Hooda bags India's 2nd gold Rinku Hooda and Sundar Singh Gurjar produced a historic one-two finish in the men's javelin throw F46 at the World Para Athletics Championships.

Pakistan players were saying lot of things, I wanted my bat to respond: Tilak Varma Pakistan players had "a lot to say" to Tilak Varma as he walked out to bat in the Asia Cup final, spurring the young Indian batter to play one of the most defining innings of his career so far in the Asia Cup final.

Watch: Mohammad Amir nearly brought to tears after Pakistan's Asia Cup final loss Mohammad Amir was nearly brought to tears after Pakistan lost the Asia Cup final to India. His reflections highlight Pakistan's batting failures and praise India's Tilak Varma's composure.

Hope an Asian team wins Women's World Cup this time: Sri Lanka captain Chamari Sri Lanka captain Chamari Athapaththu hopes an Asian side will win the Women's World Cup as her team returns to the tournament on home soil.

IND vs WI: Alzarri Joseph ruled out of India Test series due to lower back injury IND vs WI: Alzarri Joseph has been ruled out of the India Test series due to a lower back injury. This injury poses a significant challenge for the West Indies team ahead of the crucial matches.

Suryakumar Yadav shifts focus to T20 World Cup after Asia Cup heistAsia Cup 2025, IND vs PAK: After beating Pakistan by five wickets on Sunday to claim the title, Suryakumar Yadav said that India would now shift their focus to the T20 World Cup to be held next year.

India played great cricket and played like champions, now move on: Kapil DevFormer India captain, Kapil Dev wants cricket to move on following the controversial Asia Cup 2025 campaign, which saw many off-field matters take the spotlight as India went on to beat Pakistan in the final.

India humare baap hai: Pakistanis roast cricket team after Asia Cup lossFrom fans to former cricketers to journalists, Pakistanis are blasting their team and players, left, right and centre, after the team's loss to India in the Asia Cup final. There's a storm of anger, memes, and soul-searching that is laying bare the deep crisis in Pakistan cricket.

Suryakumar Yadav on India-Pakistan controversy: Not okay if you cross the lineIn an interview with India Today, Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav discussed Pakistan's provocative gestures in the Asia Cup, highlighting Sahibzada Farhan gunshot celebration and Haris Rauf's planecrash act.

Watch: After Asia Cup win, Tilak Varma gifts signed cap to Andhra Pradesh ministerTilak Varma made a heartfelt gesture, giving away an autographed cap to the Andhra Pradesh cabinet minister, Lokesh Nara following his heroic knock at the Asia Cup.

Stick to sports: Kapil Dev opens up on India-Pakistan controversy in Asia CupIn an interview with India Today, legendary India captain Kapil Dev urged that cricket remain free from political interference after India's five-wicket win over Pakistan in the Asia Cup final.

Suryakumar praises PM Modi's Op Sindoor post after Asia Cup win: He bats on front footIndian captain Suryakumar Yadav expressed gratitude for PM Modi's encouraging words after India's Asia Cup triumph. The praise has boosted the team's morale ahead of future challenges.

Suryakumar Yadav on India-Pakistan controversy: Not okay if you cross the lineIn an interview with India Today, Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav discussed Pakistan's provocative gestures in the Asia Cup, highlighting Sahibzada Farhan gunshot celebration and Haris Rauf's planecrash act.

Watch: After Asia Cup win, Tilak Varma gifts signed cap to Andhra Pradesh ministerTilak Varma made a heartfelt gesture, giving away an autographed cap to the Andhra Pradesh cabinet minister, Lokesh Nara following his heroic knock at the Asia Cup.

Stick to sports: Kapil Dev opens up on India-Pakistan controversy in Asia CupIn an interview with India Today, legendary India captain Kapil Dev urged that cricket remain free from political interference after India's five-wicket win over Pakistan in the Asia Cup final.

Suryakumar praises PM Modi's Op Sindoor post after Asia Cup win: He bats on front footIndian captain Suryakumar Yadav expressed gratitude for PM Modi's encouraging words after India's Asia Cup triumph. The praise has boosted the team's morale ahead of future challenges.

Silver stolen but spirit of gold: Champions India glitter despite Mohsin Naqvi heistAfter being denied of their moment in the spotlight by a lame attempt from PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi, the Indian team showed, through humour and passion, that their spirit will not be dimmed by any underhand tactics and celebrated their Asia Cup win.

Not collecting Asia Cup trophy will haunt India down the line: Shoaib MalikFormer Pakistan captain Shoaib Malik has claimed that India will regret the decision not to collect the Asia Cup trophy after winning it on Sunday, September 28. India decided not to take the trophy from ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi after beating Pakistan by five wickets.

Varun Chakravarthy wakes up with Cup, trolls PCB chief Naqvi after Asia Cup dramaFollowing India's Asia Cup 2025 triumph, Varun Chakravarthy humorously mocked the trophy fiasco with a tea cup post. The players celebrated creatively after PCB and ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi walked off with the actual trophy.

India's T20 competition is against Australia or England, not Pakistan: Harbhajan SinghHarbhajan Singh, while speaking exclusively to India Today, said that India's competition in T20s is with the likes of Australia, England or South Africa and not Pakistan after beating them in the Asia Cup final. Harbhajan feels that the gap with Pakistan is big at the moment.

Chamari Athapaththu goes for one last push in Sri Lanka's title huntSri Lanka return to the Women's World Cup after an eight-year absence, led by the legendary Chamari Athapaththu and a promising crop of youngsters, blending experience and youthful energy.

Asia Cup was all about India vs India: Harbhajan Singh plays down Pakistan rivalryHarbhajan Singh has claimed that the Asia Cup was always about how well India would perform in the tournament and said that the rivalry with Pakistan was well and truly over. India defeated Pakistan to win the Asia Cup 2025 final.

From bearded Vikings to smooth warriors: India complete cricket AshwamedhIndia's Asia Cup 2025 triumph showcases a new generation carrying forward the legacy of bearded giants. Tilak Varma, Shivam Dube, and Abhishek Sharma emerge as game-changers, blending fire, skill, and calculated aggression.

Abhishek Sharma subtly jabs 'premium' pacer Shaheen Afridi after Asia Cup triumphAbhishek Sharma subtly took a dig at Pakistan's "premium" pacer Shaheen Afridi after India's Asia Cup 2025 triumph, reaffirming his aggressive intent from the powerplay while leading India to their ninth title.

Watch: Arshdeep, Harshit, Jitesh mimic Abrar Ahmed's celebration after winAfter India's Asia Cup final win over Pakistan, Arshdeep Singh, Harshit Rana, and Jitesh Sharma playfully mimicked Abrar Ahmed's head-tilt celebration. India won the title after winning by five wickets.

You're getting angry: Suryakumar shuts down salty Pak reporter with witty remarkSuryakumar Yadav shut down a Pakistan reporter who questioned the Indian team's behaviour towards Pakistan during the Asia Cup 2025. India defeated Pakistan to win the title on Sunday, September 28.

Cricket was played in Asia Cup final. Tilak's day in the sun is proof of itAsia Cup final, India vs Pakistan: Long before the trophy fiasco unfolded at the Dubai stadium, Tilak Varma had crafted a masterclass knock against Pakistan in the high-pressure final, ensuring that cricket remained the true protagonist of the day.

Clairvoyants Tilak and Rinku willed on Sept 6 exactly what they would do in finalIndia players Tilak Varma and Rinku Singh made their manifestations come true with a breathtaking display in the Asia Cup 2025 final against Pakistan. Tilak anchored the innings with a brilliant 69 off 53 balls, while Rinku, getting to play for the first time in the tournament, was there to hit the winning runs on Sunday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
